meanings.definition: A group of five rulers or leaders.
meanings.sent1: The pentarchs gathered to discuss important matters.
meanings.sent2: The pentarchs met to make decisions for the kingdom.
meanings.sent3: The pentarchs tried to decide who would be the best at playing hide-and-seek.
meanings.sent4: In the story, the pentarchs were like the five fingers of a hand, each with its own strength.
meanings.sent5: The pentarchs, with their different skills, formed a powerful team.

meanings.definition: The rulers of the five ancient patriarchates of the Christian Church.
meanings.sent1: The pentarchs of the Christian Church led their followers with wisdom.
meanings.sent2: Historians studied the roles of the pentarchs in shaping the Church's history.
meanings.sent3: The pentarchs had a friendly competition to see who could recite the most prayers.
meanings.sent4: The influence of the pentarchs in the Church was like the roots of a strong tree.
meanings.sent5: The pentarchs' decisions echoed through the halls of the ancient Church.
